document.masterDocTitle: A review of Timandra Duponchel, 1829 from China, with description of seven new species (Lepidoptera, Geometridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Timandra Duponchel, 1829 from China, with description of seven new species (Lepidoptera, Geometridae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Timandra comptaria Walker, 1863: 1615. Syntypes 1♂1♀, China; Hindostan [India] (NHM).

This species is similar to T. paralias , but the frons is less protruded than in T. paralias and the postmedial line of the hindwing is close to the medial line in T. comptaria , while it is far from the medial line in T. paralias . In the male genitalia, the arms between the valvula and the sacculus are symmetrical in T. comptaria , but these are asymmetrical in T. paralias and the right arm is slightly angled terminally; the sacculus is longer than the valvula in T. comptaria , while it is shorter than the valvula in T. paralias ; the apex of the aedeagus is curved in T. comptaria , but it is straight in T. paralias ; the cornutus is composed of one sclerotized stripe in T. comptaria , while in T. paralias , two sclerotized stripes are present on the vesica of T. paralias . The seventh sternite is slightly concave in the middle of the posterior margin in T. comptaria , but it is produced in T. paralias ; in the female genitalia, the colliculum is absent in T. comptaria , while it is short funnel-shaped in T. paralias ( Kaila and Albrecht 1994 : fig. 17).

CHINA: Taiwan (NHM): 1♂, holotype, 1933/395; 1♀, 11.V.1906, A.E. Wileman, Rothschild Bequest, 1939-1; 1♂, Kanshirei, 1000 ft. 19.IV.1906, A.E. Wileman, Wileman Coll. B. M. 1929-261.
